spaceCenter.name: Space Center Houston
spaceCenter.description: The official visitor center of NASA Johnson Space Center, featuring spacecraft, artifacts, and interactive exhibits about space exploration.

tramTour.name: NASA Tram Tour
tramTour.description: Tour of NASA Johnson Space Center, including Mission Control and Rocket Park

independence.name: Independence Plaza
independence.description: Shuttle Independence mounted on the original NASA 905 shuttle carrier aircraft

starship.name: Starship Gallery
starship.description: Collection of spacecraft including Apollo 17 command module and Lunar Samples Vault

mars.name: Mission Mars
mars.description: Interactive exhibit about Mars exploration with full-scale models

iss.name: International Space Station Gallery
iss.description: Learn about life aboard the ISS with interactive displays

rocketPark.name: Rocket Park
rocketPark.description: View the enormous Saturn V rocket that took astronauts to the moon

tips: Purchase tickets online in advance to avoid lines
Plan to spend at least 4-5 hours to see everything
The NASA Tram Tour can have long wait times; do this early in your visit
Download the Space Center Houston app for maps and schedules
Bring water and wear comfortable shoes
Check the daily schedule for special presentations and films
Consider the Space Center Houston Audio Tour for additional information
transportation: By Car: 30-45 minutes from downtown Houston via I-45 South
Ride-sharing: Uber/Lyft available, approximately $35-45 from downtown
Public Transit: Limited options, consider renting a car or using ride-sharing

kemah.name: Kemah Boardwalk
kemah.description: A 60-acre waterfront entertainment complex with rides, restaurants, and shopping, located on Galveston Bay.

attractions.name: Boardwalk Beast
attractions.description: High-speed boat ride on Galveston Bay

attractions.name: Ferris Wheel
attractions.description: 65-foot wheel with views of Galveston Bay

restaurants.name: Bubba Gump Shrimp Co.
restaurants.description: Shrimp dishes inspired by the movie Forrest Gump

tips: Visit on weekdays to avoid crowds
Check the weather forecast before visiting (many attractions are outdoors)
Consider the All-Day Ride Pass if you plan to enjoy multiple rides
Make restaurant reservations in advance, especially on weekends
Bring sunscreen and a hat for outdoor activities
Check the entertainment schedule for live music and special events
transportation: By Car: 35-50 minutes from downtown Houston via I-45 South
From Space Center Houston: 15-20 minutes by car
Public Transit: Limited options, consider renting a car or using ride-sharing
